Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: an enclosed central courtyard

Lit by overheadDimly lit by overhead and ringed on all sides by the two story structure of the manor, this inner courtyard is open to the sky save for a patio beneath a semicircular trellised balcony above to the south. The balcony is held aloft by thin columns accented by long, fluttering white drapes that can be pulled shut to provide additional privacy and protection from wind or sun to the seating area underneath. The remaining portion of the courtyard is decorated by three raised garden beds, each one showcasing a statue of a crane in various elegant poses. The eastern exit is a large pointed arch, while the remaining exits to the north, west, southwest, and southeast are glass pane double doors with large glass windows spaced beside each one. Up higher on the second floor, matching windows with pointed arches are decorated with narrow window boxes.

the east wall

The eastern wall, two stories in height, is crafted from stacked limestone bricks. A large pointed arch is set into the center of this wall, flanked by a pair of large pointed arch windows on either side.

the north wall

The northern wall, two stories in height, is crafted from stacked limestone bricks. A pair of glass pane double doors is set into the center of this wall, flanked by large pointed arch windows on either side.

the south wall

The southern wall, two stories in height, is crafted from stacked limestone bricks. Two pairs of glass pane double doors are set into the western and eastern sides of this wall, each flanked by large pointed arch windows on either side.
